job_title: Accounts Payable Specialist in Huntsville, AL
pros: Everyone is great to work with, There is no micromanaging. They are great to work with your schedule (some people get to work from home) how many places do you know that does that. The benefits are awesome! My boss is awesome!
cons: The only thing I think they could improve on is pay!

job_title: School Based Therapist in Huntsville, AL
pros: Good for gaining experience if you are a new graduate or new to the profession, very flexible
cons: Terrible pay, incompetent supervisors, catty workplace drama, unprofessionalism, limited opportunities for financial growth, racial and gender disparities, and so much more

pros: Great People where I work in the CSU in Cullman
cons: Low Pay Insurance for Families too high

pros: - Gives raises/bonuses. - Experience in providing services, billing, and working with facility staffing. - Opportunity to grow in career paths.
cons: - Pays less than competing companies. - If contracted at a facility, you won't have the same resources as those who work in a company-owned facility.

pros: Work/life balance, co-workers, feeling appreciated by management, benefits, working for a company that is committed to mental health. Pro's will likely be department specific.
cons: No cons in my day-to-day job but some departments have high employee turnover rate though it has not impacted my department. Cons also will likely be department specific.

review_title: A place I can see myself retiring.
pros: I enjoy working for a job where I am not micromanaged, My department works well together. I have a supervisor who cares. We are given yearly incentives.
cons: 8 hour days are not always a requirement.

review_title: It's not the best but not the worst...
pros: Accommodating work schedules. Central location.
cons: LOW pay, expensive family benefits, unprofessional employees

review_title: Not the best job but a good start
job_title: Mental Health Technician in Huntsville, AL
pros: People are ok bonuses are ok
cons: overworking no leadership not enough staff

pros: Nice people and good managements
cons: Low salary and that’s about it

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Jeffersonville, IN
pros: The nursing CEO has vast knowledge in both mental heath and acute care.
cons: Lowest pay in the area , horrible heath insurance, night nursing supervisors have zero acute care experience their worthless in medical emergency. Supervisors cannot even work the floor they don't know what to do. No security. They admit anyone very aggressive and homicidal patients. Now taking mentally ill from the jails. This facility all about profitabilty.. They do not care about nursing retention, their replacing nursing staff with inexperienced young new grad nurses with max of year experience from nursing agency. Also hire nursing supervisors that have acute care knowledge or at least knows how work the floor , when you call night shift supervisor they usually cannot answer your question or help you with any paperwork or medical care. Your supervisors don't even know how draw blood.

review_title: I have taken so much knowledge from this job that I will still use in my daily life
pros: I love all the staff! You get to watch people grow when you have seen them at some of their lowest times.
cons: You get very close to the patients and of course you are happy to see them better and getting to go to a group home or to their families but a part of you will feel sad but you will get use to the way things flow, and learn how to just feel nothing but happiness for them!

pros: Good professional experience, and Continuing Education credit opportunities
cons: disingenuous leadership. No care for employees or clients. Want you to be a numbers mill. Executive team encourages insurance fraud, urging providers to bill for services not rendered, or bill for higher paying services versus actual service provided.

pros:
I enjoyed my co-workers and lead therapist
I had a little bit of a flex schedule where I could occasionally leave early on Fridays
cons:
The pay is not good at all. 
Some of the leaders struggled with being good leaders

review_title: Lack of authenticity from higher superiors
job_title: School Based Therapist in Huntsville, AL
pros: Direct supervisors were supportive until they resigned.
cons: You could truly tell the less active the supervisors and managers were within client services, the less concern, compassion, and authenticity they had. It truly felt like the clients were numbers, the staff was numbers, and unless you made a certain quote of billable hours then the bosses just did not give a care about you.

job_title: Clinical Treatment Team in Huntsville, AL
pros: Great benefits, great coworkers, great experience to get with Medicaid clients. Sometimes one time bonuses like COVID. Free food and tshirts sometimes.
cons: Clinical staff not appreciated, raises not given without promotions, turnover rate very high in lots of areas.. Not designed to be a place for staff to stay long term.

pros: Good life experience. I had a great supervisor so that really helped me manage my cases better.
cons: Not a lot of training beyond on boarding. If you work overtime in a week there is a holiday, they will cut out holiday time to adjust to a 40 hour week and will not pay you overtime.

pros: They provide continuing education. They can do supervision if you want.
cons: The pay is very low. The paperwork is a lot and they push numbers.

job_title: School Based Therapist in Huntsville, AL
pros: They offer a Flexible schedule
cons: Pay could be a lot better

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Huntsville, AL
pros: Room for growth learning from therapists, social workers, registered nurses and case managers.
cons: I am not sure about pay raises.

pros:
- Love working with my clients, interacting with the  community, and doing actual clinical work
- Decent benefits
cons:
- Poor support for therapists, therapists are treated as bottom-of-the-barrel employees
- Horrific pay and no raises or incentives
- Poor communication and terrible training. Employees often get written up for policies they were never told existed. 
- Great therapists can be fired over very small administrative issues, while terrible therapists stay employed for years, despite ethical complaints, etc.
- Productivity is stressed at the expense of client care

pros: Co-workers, working with clients and helping them lead their best lives
cons: Pay, benefits, you name it

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Madison, AL
pros:
-Full-time Benefits are okay, along with PTO.
-entry level position
- Working with the mentally ill can be rewarding.
-Paid training days
-Managers will work with you on time and finding replacements for uncovered shifts.
-Being able to work with residents and teach them things that will help them in the future can be rewarding to morale
-great job for a college student looking for some experience in the mental health sector
cons:
-Not very much room for upward mobility. 
-You will be expected to take residents to places for little pay and little to no coverage on vehicles driven.
-Pay for residential work is low, might as well work at Mc. Donalds for the same wage and benefits, they may even pay more. It can be very boring at times, the work pace stays the same for the most part. 
-Employee are expected to teach and care for residents with little pay and little to no resources. 
-Training is poor, workers are expected to submit notes in a timely manner without proper training and little pay. Also training for other tasks is poor.
- You will be expected to train new and incoming staff on using software for documenting without any  compensation.

review_title: Great co-workers, poor raises, and lackluster administration.
pros:
The “floor staff” and patients are generally rewarding experiences. 
There’s a “we’re in this together” bonding. 
Plenty of overtime available.
cons:
Very minimal pay raises. 
Staff in general doesn’t feel appreciated or have their hard work recognized. 
Worst place I’ve ever worked in terms of rumors and sabotaging other staff. 
Administration tends to be very punitive. 
High patient to staff ratios. 
Plenty of overtime being available means working short handed.

job_title: Adult Case Manager in Huntsville, AL
pros: Good clients, great experience in mental health, other case workers help and work with you, team environment.
cons: low pay, big case load, in people's homes and they're in your car, not 100% safe.

job_title: Substance Abuse Counselor in Huntsville, AL
pros: Client oriented/driven, caring staff, good benefits and insurance, friendly co-worker
cons: PAY.....they don't pay anywhere near the bottom of what would be considered the worth of professionals and give no raises.... and lose alot of good people as a result...

pros: Benefits, PTO, Holiday Leave, Flexible hours
cons: Low pay for some of these positions
